bug.author: yanniszark
bug.description:
What happened: kfctl apply failed with: <denchmark-code>ERRO[0306] (Will retry) Component pipeline apply failed; Error: handle object: creating object: creating object: persistentvolumes "mysql-pv" is forbidden: error querying GCE PD volume <deployName>-storage-metadata-store: googleapi: Error 400: Invalid value '<deployName>-storage-metadata-store'. Values must match the following regular expression: '[a-z](?:[-a-z0-9]{0,61}[a-z0-9])?|[1-9][0-9]{0,19}', invalidParameter filename="ksonnet/ksonnet.go:175" </denchmark-code>
Steps to reproduce:
Checkout commit f077966c2a2261517708d98833925b37ce150a86 (Friday 24 May 2019) cd bootstrap and make build-kfctl-container cd bin and follow Kubeflow on Kubernetes guide.
It seems that kfctl isn't changing the name of the PVs for the default installation. In addition, this installation will not work on non-GCP environments as it specifically creates a GCE Persistent Volume.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> ! The PR for fixing Istio VirtualServices for on-prem installations (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3376>#3376</denchmark-link> ) also fixes this. The problem is that the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/cad6f3f914dab749c4fd77441c05f17c7b134b6f/bootstrap/config/overlays/ksonnet/kfctl_default.yaml>default ksonnet base overlay</denchmark-link> has hardcoded options for using a GCP PD. Not only that, but those are only handled by the gcp-specific code of kfctl, leaving the default installation broken. In the aforementioned PR, I fixed the default ksonnet overlay so that it contains the correct options for a default installation.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link> 's fix was merged, my suggestion to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> was to only define these componentParams in one place - though <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3375>#3375</denchmark-link> will remove these values anyway once it's merged.
I think this is no longer relevant
